author: San Jose Mercury News (TNS)
title: Draymond Green: Earth ‘could be’ flat
text:
Draymond Green: Earth ‘could be’ flat ‘I don’t know,’ Draymond Green said of the earth’s shape. ‘I haven’t done enough research.’ Post to Facebook Draymond Green: Earth ‘could be’ flat ‘I don’t know,’ Draymond Green said of the earth’s shape. ‘I haven’t done enough research.’   Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/2lnbC0q   1   Draymond Green: Earth ‘could be’ flat Anthony Slater, San Jose Mercury News (TNS) Published 10:39 a.m. ET Feb. 20, 2017 | Updated 17 minutes ago CLOSE x Share Former Michigan State basketball star Draymond Green speaks with reporters Friday, Feb. 17, 2017, at NBA All-Star Weekend in New Orleans. Video by Chris Nelsen / Special to the DFP Draymond Green, left, drives to the basket past Isaiah Thomas in the NBA All-Star Game on Feb. 19, 2017, in New Orleans. (Photo: Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports) 5 CONNECT 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NEW ORLEANS – An unexpected storyline emerged from All-Star weekend in New Orleans : NBA players discussing whether they believe the world is round or flat. 
A recent comment by Cleveland Cavaliers point guard Kyrie Irving — mentioning his belief that the world is flat — spurred the conversation. A batch of players were asked about it this weekend. Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green (Michigan State) didn’t disagree. 
“I don’t know,” Green said. “I haven’t done enough research. But it may be flat.” 
Read more: Kings agree to trade DeMarcus Cousins to Pelicans 
Forget all the scientific evidence and the images, from space, of a round Earth. 
“Who’s to say that picture is telling the truth?” the Saginaw native asked. “I can make a round picture with my iPhone today and make it look round. So I don’t know. I’m not saying I think it’s flat or round. I don’t know. But it could be.”
